com.opengamma.strata.engine.marketdata.scenarios

Interface Perturbation<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of the market data handled by the perturbation
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CurveParallelShift, CurvePointShift

    public interface Perturbation<T>
    Describes a perturbation applied to a single piece of data as part of a scenario.

    For example, a 5 basis point parallel shift of a curve, or a 10% increase in the quoted price of a security.

    Perturbation implementations should generally implement the Joda Beans ImmutableBean interface which allows them to be serialized and used from remote clients.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T apply(T marketData)
      Applies the perturbation to some market data, returning a new, modified instance of the data.
      static <T> Perturbation<T> none()
      Returns a perturbation that returns its input unchanged.

    • Method Detail

      • none

        static <T> Perturbation<T> none()
        Returns a perturbation that returns its input unchanged.

        This is useful for creating base scenarios where none of the market data is perturbed.

        Returns:
        a perturbation that returns its input unchanged

      • apply

        T apply(T marketData)
        Applies the perturbation to some market data, returning a new, modified instance of the data.
        Parameters:
        marketData - a piece of market data
        Returns:
        a new item of market data derived by applying the perturbation to the input data
